title: House on Wilson Street
description: It was a lovely day when the detective went to the estate to visit an old foe. Unfortunately said old foe was now dead. Plenty of people had every right to be upset with the doctor, but the Detective had hoped to deliver him to prison rather than the morgue. Oh well, you take what you can get. Which in this case was a murderer. This was often the case.

personList.name: Blue
personList.description: A sad, sad man. Or at least that's the impression you'd get from his music. It was the number one hit for like 2 days back in '86

personList.name: Red
personList.description: He was a champion fighter for a long time. Unfortunately for him, it was dog fighting, so he's been in prison. He's out now, and pretty pissed about the whole arrest thing. RIP Pika-pooch

personList.name: Green
personList.description: She's a hacker, though her haters would tell you she's just a hack. Hard to argue with millions of dollars that she definitely got from that bank legally though.

weaponList.name: Gun
weaponList.description: Simple and effective. A classic murder weapon

weaponList.name: Axe
weaponList.description: Excellent for cutting wood. Or murder. Or cutting wood to be used in later murder

weaponList.name: Fork
weaponList.description: Generally best for eating, but not too bad at stabbing either.

locationList.name: Forest
locationList.description: Oh hey look! Trees! We should go exploring! There's definitely no axe murderers to run from in there!

locationList.name: House
locationList.description: They say a doctor lives here. Injured his leg a while ago. Not sure why he has such a big place then.

locationList.name: Bunker
locationList.description: For all your prepper faves, because your preppy faves wouldn't be caught dead in here. It's too underground for them.

cluesList: The Axe had recently been used properly
The Fork was held by someone named after a long wavelength of light
All silverware was where it belonged
hint: There would be a really good hint here if I knew how to write a good hint.

resolution.resolutionText: Blue protested his innocence for a solid second before caving. "Fine, take me away. None of it matters anyways." Honestly, the Detective was starting to feel depressed himself. Nothing a celebratory drink couldn't solve though.
